package.name: cogency
package.docstring: Cogency - A framework for building intelligent agents.

classes.name: Agent
classes.docstring:
Cognitive agent with streaming execution and tool integration.

Simple API for building intelligent agents with:
- Streaming execution
- Tool integration
- Memory management
- Adaptive reasoning

methods.name: process
methods.docstring: Process input text with optional context (MCP compatibility).
methods.signature: (self, input_text: str, context: Optional[cogency.context.Context] = None) -> str

methods.name: run
methods.docstring: Run agent and return response.

methods.name: serve_mcp
methods.docstring: Start MCP server with specified transport (stdio or websocket).
methods.signature: (self, transport: str = 'stdio', host: str = 'localhost', port: int = 8765)

methods.name: stream
methods.docstring: Stream agent execution with input validation.

methods.name: traces
methods.docstring: Get traces from last execution.

classes.init_signature: (self, name: str, trace: bool = False, verbose: bool = True, **opts)

classes.name: Context
classes.docstring: Agent conversation context.

methods.name: add_message
methods.docstring: Add message to history.
methods.signature: (self, role: str, content: str, trace_id: Optional[str] = None)

methods.name: add_result
methods.docstring: Add tool result to history.
methods.signature: (self, tool_name: str, args: dict, output: dict)

methods.name: add_turn
methods.docstring: Add conversation turn.
methods.signature: (self, query: str, response: str, metadata: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None)

methods.name: clear_history
methods.docstring: Clear conversation history.

methods.name: get_clean_conversation
methods.docstring: Get conversation without system messages.

methods.name: recent_turns
methods.docstring: Get last n conversation turns, filtering out system and internal messages.

classes.init_signature: (self, query: str, messages: List[Dict[str, str]] = None, tool_results: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None, max_history: Optional[int] = 20, conversation_history: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None, user_id: str = 'default')

classes.name: FileBackend
classes.docstring: Filesystem storage implementation.

methods.name: create
methods.docstring: CREATE - Standard artifact creation with storage delegation.
methods.signature: (self, content: str, memory_type: cogency.memory.core.MemoryType = <MemoryType.FACT: 'fact'>, tags: Optional[List[str]] = None, metadata: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None, **kwargs) -> cogency.memory.core.Memory

methods.name: delete
methods.docstring: DELETE - Unified deletion with storage delegation.
methods.signature: (self, artifact_id: uuid.UUID = None, tags: Optional[List[str]] = None, filters: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None, delete_all: bool = False) -> bool

methods.name: read
methods.docstring: READ - Unified retrieval with storage delegation.
methods.signature: (self, query: str = None, artifact_id: uuid.UUID = None, search_type: cogency.memory.core.SearchType = <SearchType.AUTO: 'auto'>, limit: int = 10, threshold: float = 0.7, tags: Optional[List[str]] = None, memory_type: Optional[cogency.memory.core.MemoryType] = None, filters: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None, **kwargs) -> List[cogency.memory.core.Memory]

methods.name: update
methods.docstring: UPDATE - Standard update logic with storage delegation.
methods.signature: (self, artifact_id: uuid.UUID, updates: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool

classes.name: Flow
classes.docstring: LangGraph wrapper for agent workflow.
classes.init_signature: (self, llm, tools, memory: cogency.memory.core.MemoryBackend, routing_table: Optional[Dict] = None, identity: Optional[str] = None, json_schema: Optional[str] = None, system_prompt: Optional[str] = None)

classes.name: Output
classes.docstring:
Single source of truth for all agent output.

This class centralizes all output operations for Cogency agents, including:
- Trace collection for debugging and development
- User-facing progress updates
- Tool execution logging
- Consistent formatting and emoji usage

Attributes:
    tracing: Whether to collect trace entries
    verbose: Whether to display user-facing updates
    callback: Optional streaming callback function
    entries: List of collected trace entries

methods.name: log_tool
methods.docstring:
Log tool execution with status.

Displays tool execution results with appropriate formatting
and emoji indicators.

Args:
    tool_name: Name of the executed tool
    result: Result data from tool execution
    success: Whether the tool execution was successful
    
Returns:
    None
methods.signature: (self, tool_name: str, result: Any, success: bool = True)

methods.name: reset_traces
methods.docstring:
Clear all trace entries.

Returns:
    None

methods.name: send
methods.docstring:
Route messages to appropriate output methods by type.

Unified interface for sending different types of messages through
the output system.

Args:
    message_type: Type of message ("trace", "update", "tool_execution", etc.)
    content: Message content
    node: Optional node identifier
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for specific message types
    
Returns:
    None
methods.signature: (self, message_type: str, content: str, node: Optional[str] = None, **kwargs)

methods.name: tool_emoji
methods.docstring:
Get tool-specific emoji.

Args:
    tool_name: Name of the tool
    
Returns:
    str: Emoji character for the tool

methods.name: trace
methods.docstring:
Developer trace output with collection.

Records trace entries for debugging and development purposes.
If a callback is provided and tracing is enabled, also streams
the trace message to the callback.

Args:
    message: The trace message to record
    node: Optional node identifier (e.g., "reason", "act")
    **kwargs: Additional metadata to store with the trace
    
Returns:
    None

methods.name: traces
methods.docstring:
Get trace entries.

Returns:
    List[Dict[str, Any]]: Copy of all collected trace entries

methods.name: update
methods.docstring:
Display user progress updates.

Shows user-facing progress updates if verbose mode is enabled
and a callback is available.

Args:
    message: The update message to display
    type: Message type for emoji selection (info, reasoning, tool, etc.)
    **kwargs: Additional parameters (unused)
    
Returns:
    None

classes.init_signature: (self, trace: bool = False, verbose: bool = True, callback: Optional[Callable[[str], NoneType]] = None)

classes.name: State
classes.docstring: Agent state with dict-like access.

methods.name: get
methods.signature: (self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any

classes.init_signature: (self, context: cogency.context.Context, query: str, output: cogency.output.Output = <factory>, flow: Dict[str, Any] = <factory>) -> None

classes.name: StreamRunner
classes.docstring: Streaming wrapper for user-facing Chain-of-Thought.

methods.name: stream
methods.docstring: Execute flow with streaming callback for user updates.
methods.signature: (self, flow, state: cogency.state.State, stream_cb: Callable[[str], Awaitable[NoneType]])

classes.name: ToolRegistry
classes.docstring: Auto-discovery registry for tools.

functions.name: detect_llm
functions.docstring:
Auto-detect LLM provider from environment variables.

Fallback chain:
1. OpenAI
2. Anthropic
3. Gemini
4. Grok
5. Mistral

Returns:
    BaseLLM: Configured LLM instance
    
Raises:
    RuntimeError: If no API keys found for any provider.

classes.name: AnthropicLLM
classes.docstring:
Base class for all LLM implementations in the cogency framework.

All LLM providers support:
- Streaming execution for real-time output
- Automatic key rotation for high-volume usage  
- Rate limiting via yield_interval parameter
- Unified interface across providers
- Dynamic model/parameter configuration

methods.name: ainvoke
methods.docstring: LangGraph compatibility method - wrapper around invoke().

methods.name: next_key
methods.docstring: Get next API key - rotates automatically on every call.

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Generate a response from the LLM given a list of messages.

Args:
    messages: List of message dictionaries with 'role' and 'content' keys
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for the LLM call

Returns:
    String response from the LLM

methods.name: stream
methods.docstring:
Generate a streaming response from the LLM given a list of messages.

Args:
    messages: List of message dictionaries with 'role' and 'content' keys
    yield_interval: Minimum time between yields for rate limiting (seconds)
    **kwargs: Additional parameters for the LLM call

Yields:
    String chunks from the LLM response
methods.signature: (self, messages: List[Dict[str, str]], yield_interval: float = 0.0, **kwargs) -> AsyncIterator[str]

classes.init_signature: (self, api_keys: Union[str, List[str]] = None, model: str = 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022', timeout: float = 15.0, temperature: float = 0.7, max_tokens: int = 4096, max_retries: int = 3, **kwargs)

classes.name: KeyManager
classes.docstring: Unified key management - auto-detects, handles rotation, eliminates provider DRY.

methods.name: get_current
methods.docstring: Get the current active key.

methods.name: get_next
methods.docstring: Get next key in rotation - advances every call.

methods.name: has_multiple
methods.docstring: Check if we have multiple keys available for rotation.

methods.name: rotate_key
methods.docstring: Rotate to next key if rotator exists. Returns feedback message.

classes.init_signature: (self, api_key: Optional[str] = None, key_rotator: Optional[cogency.utils.keys.KeyRotator] = None)

classes.name: KeyRotator
classes.docstring: Simple key rotator for API rate limit avoidance.

methods.name: get_current_key
methods.docstring: Get current key without advancing.

methods.name: get_next_key
methods.docstring: Get next key in rotation - advances every call.

methods.name: rotate_key
methods.docstring: Rotate to next key immediately. Returns feedback.

classes.name: CSV
classes.docstring: Read, write, and manipulate CSV files with various operations.

methods.name: examples
methods.docstring: Return example usage patterns.

methods.name: execute
methods.docstring: Execute tool with automatic error handling - USE THIS, NOT run() directly.

methods.name: format_params
methods.docstring: Format parameters for display.

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Execute CSV operation using dispatch pattern.

Args:
    operation: CSV operation (read, write, filter, analyze, transform, append)
    file_path: Path to CSV file
    data: Data for write/append operations (list of dicts)
    delimiter: CSV delimiter (default: comma)
    headers: Column headers for write operations
    filter_condition: Python expression for filtering (e.g., "row['age'] > 25")
    limit: Maximum number of rows to process
    
Returns:
    Operation results including data, metadata, and statistics
methods.signature: (self, operation: str, file_path: str, data: Optional[List[Dict]] = None, delimiter: str = ',', headers: Optional[List[str]] = None, filter_condition: Optional[str] = None, limit: Optional[int] = None, **kwargs) -> Dict[str, Any]

methods.name: schema
methods.docstring: Return the tool call schema.

methods.name: run
methods.docstring:
Execute HTTP request using dispatch pattern.

Args:
    url: Target URL for the request
    method: HTTP method (get, post, put, delete, patch)
    headers: Optional HTTP headers dict
    body: Optional request body as string
    json_data: Optional JSON data (automatically sets content-type)
    auth: Optional auth dict with 'type' and credentials
    timeout: Request timeout in seconds (default: 30)
    
Returns:
    Response data including status, headers, and body
methods.signature: (self, url: str, method: str = 'get', headers: Optional[Dict] = None, body: Optional[str] = None, json_data: Optional[Dict] = None, auth: Optional[Dict] = None, timeout: int = 30, **kwargs) -> Dict[str, Any]

functions.name: detect_embedder
functions.docstring:
Auto-detect embedding provider from environment variables.

Fallback chain:
1. OpenAI
2. Nomic
3. Sentence Transformers (local)

Returns:
    BaseEmbed: Configured embedder instance
    
Raises:
    RuntimeError: If no API keys found and sentence-transformers is not installed.

utils.name: utils
utils.docstring: Shared utilities for robust LLM response handling.

functions.name: demo_header
functions.docstring: Print clean demo header with emoji and separator.

functions.name: parse_json
functions.docstring:
Extract JSON from LLM response with markdown cleaning and error handling.

Handles:
- Markdown code fences (```json and ```)
- Proper brace matching for JSON objects
- Graceful fallback on parsing errors

Args:
    response: Raw LLM response string
    fallback: Default dict to return on parsing errors
    
Returns:
    Parsed JSON dict or fallback
functions.signature: (response: str, fallback: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]

functions.name: showcase
functions.docstring:
Print demo showcase section with bullet points.

Args:
    title: Showcase section title (e.g. "ðŸŽ¯ This demo showcases:")
    items: List of features/capabilities to highlight

functions.name: stream_response
functions.docstring:
Stream response with smooth character-by-character output.

Args:
    stream: Async iterator of string chunks
    char_delay: Delay between characters for smooth typing effect
    rich: Whether to render with rich formatting
    prefix: Custom prefix for agent responses (default: "ðŸ¤–: ")
    
Returns:
    Complete response text
functions.signature: (stream: AsyncIterator[str], char_delay: float = 0.005, rich: bool = True, prefix: str = 'ðŸ¤–: ') -> str

functions.name: tips
functions.docstring: Print tips section with bullet points.
